pictures.name: First oil well, Bahrain
pictures.caption: A photograph of the First Oil Well in Bahrain, with oil first being extracted in 1931. This was photographed in 1931 by members of BAPCO and the Bahraini government.

pictures.name: Oil fires set in Kuwait during the Gulf War by Iraqi forces
pictures.caption: Oil fires in Kuwait in 1991, which were a result of the scorched earth policy of Iraqi military forces retreating from Kuwait.

A crowd of Kuwaiti spectators erupt in cheers bearing a message of peace during the 50/20 Celebration parade in Kuwait Feb. 26. The 50/20 Celebration honors 50 years of Kuwaiti independence and the 20 years since Operations Desert Storm.
pictures.name: Kuwaiti youth celebrating Kuwait's independence and liberation, 2011

pictures.caption: Supplicating pilgrim at Al-Masjid Al-Ḥarām (Arabic: ٱلْـمَـسْـجِـد ٱلْـحَـرَام‎, The Sacred Mosque) in Mecca. The Ka‘bah (Arabic: كَـعـبَـة‎, lit. 'Cube', Kaaba) is the cubic building in front of the pilgrim.
pictures.name: Supplicating Pilgrim at Masjid Al Haram
Saudi in niqap
pictures.caption: Saudi woman wearing a niqāb in Riyadh. Under Saudi law, women are required to wear a abaya but niqab and hijab is optional.

pictures.caption: L to R: Abdel Fattah el-Sisi, King Salman of Saudi Arabia, Melania Trump, and Donald Trump, May 2017 President Donald Trump and First Lady Melania Trump join King Salman bin Abdulaziz Al Saud of Saudi Arabia, and the President of Egypt, Abdel Fattah Al Sisi, Sunday, May 21, 2017, to participate in the inaugural opening of the Global Center for Combating Extremist Ideology.

Mid-20th century Dubai
pictures.caption: Dubai in 1950; the area in this photo shows Bur Dubai in the foreground (centered on Al-Fahidi Fort); Deira in middle-right on the other side of the creek; and Al Shindagha (left) and Al Ras (right) in the background across the creek again from Deira

The Bahraini emir Isa bin Salman Al Khalifa (middle) heads the opening session of the first conference on the formation of a union consisting of the emirates of the Persian Gulf in February 1968. Shaikh Zayed bin Sultan Al Nahyan is seen middle left.
